5 Using Custom Templates
This chapter demonstrates how to use custom templates to enhance your book’s appearance and functionality.

title: 4  Using Custom Templates
text:
5.1 Callout Boxes
Callout boxes are a great way to highlight important information, warnings, or tips in your book.






title: Information Callout type: info
This is a standard information callout box. Use this for general information that you want to highlight.









title: Warning Message type: warning
This is a warning callout. Use this to warn readers about potential issues or things to watch out for.









title: Danger Alert type: danger
This is a danger callout. Use this for critical warnings or dangerous situations.









title: Success Message type: success
This is a success callout. Use this to highlight achievements or successful steps.

text:
6.1 How Templates Work
Templates work by providing reusable HTML and LaTeX code that can be customized with parameters. To use a template:

Define the template in your config.yaml file or as separate files in the templates directory
Use the ::: syntax in your Markdown to apply the template
Provide parameters to customize the template’s appearance

The template system supports both inline templates (defined directly in config.yaml) and file-based templates (stored in the templates directory).
